bibl.title: A Botanical Contribution to the Analysis of Subsistence and Trade at Berenike (Red Sea Coast, Egypt); - Discussion.

Life on the Fringe. Living in the Southern Egyptian Deserts during the Roman and Early-Byzantine Periods. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held on the Occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the Netherlands Institute for Archaeology and Arabic Studies in Cairo 9-12 December 1996
bibl.author: CAPPERS, R.T.J.

bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Subsistence. - 3. Trade. - 4. Conclusions. Local agriculture could have been practised on a small scale. Archaeobotanical research sheds new light on the import and export of plant products as described in the Periplus Maris Erythraei.
